pull.title: newcomer can think bitcoincore.org is Bitcoin homepage.
pull.body:
i dont i am fooled,maybe this just what i think..
newcomer can think bitcoincore.org is Bitcoin.

events.message: can this still bitcoin.org? bitcoincore.org that is an developer teams page?

something like bitcoincore.org for Bitcoin

not like bitcoincore.org is Bitcoin,

events.body: NACK, this is the Bitcoin Core client. bitcoin.org is purposefully client-agnostic.
@cdecker Why do you use the word agnostic? which I think is not a rejection of the earlier,.

Actually, I think it would be better if the repo and the organization was renamed to bitcoin-core to continue the decoupling of Bitcoin Core away from being the official Bitcoin in general like what they are trying to do with moving Bitcoin core to bitcoincore.org.

A newcomer will probably end up on bitcoin.org, or one of the other introductory sites. It's unlikely their first experience with bitcoin will be our README.md file.

In any case that file introduces our project, not bitcoin in general.

> Actually, I think it would be better if the repo and the organization was renamed to bitcoin-core to continue the decoupling of Bitcoin Core away from being the official Bitcoin in general like what they are trying to do with moving Bitcoin core to bitcoincore.org.

Yes, I'd like to do Bitcoin Core development under the bitcoin-core organization instead. However, a ton of links would have to be updated, which is the reason such a move hasn't been done yet.
@vlamer Note bitcoin.org is _also_ not Bitcoin's homepage. Bitcoin is a decentralised project; it does not have anything official anywhere.
